definition: (archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

pinyin: wai4 guo2 ren2 ju1 zhu4 zheng4 ming2

sentences.english: To qualify for permanent residency, applicants must hold a Shanghai Residency Card and have lived in the city for at least seven years.
sentences.chinese: 申請落戶者必須持有上海市居住證滿7年。

sentences.english: She is grant a residence permit for one year.
sentences.chinese: 她被給予一張爲期一年的居住證。

sentences.english: The Certificate of Work and Residence in Beijing shall be valid for two years.
sentences.chinese: 《北京市工作居住證》有效期限爲兩年。

sentences.english: Foreign governments want to sell them passports and residence cards.
sentences.chinese: 外國政府想向他們兜售護照和居住證。

sentences.english: Year residence permit for the conditions is to look at your work contract is a few years.
sentences.chinese: 申請的居住證年份條件就是看你的工作合同是幾年。

definition: receipt (written acknowledgement of receipt of an item)
Mainland Travel Permit for Taiwan Residents/Taiwan Compatriot Entry Permit/abbr. for 台灣居民來往大陸通行證|台湾居民来往大陆通行证[Tai2 wan1 Ju1 min2 Lai2 wang3 Da4 lu4 Tong1 xing2 zheng4]
a pass (authority to enter)/a laissez-passer or safe conduct
to issue a card/(slang) to reject a guy or a girl/to chuck
to affix a seal/to stamp (a document)/to sign off on sth
